title: The One With the East German Laundry Detergent

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, all six are there.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Would you let it go? It's not that big a deal.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Not that big a deal? It's amazing. Ok, you just reach in there, there's one little maneuver, and bam, a bra right out the sleeve. All right, as far as I'm concerned, there is nothing a guy can do that even comes close. Am I right?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on! You guys can pee standing up.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We can? All right, I'm tryin' that.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ok, you know what blows my mind? Women can see breasts any time they want. You just look down and there they are. How you get any work done is beyond me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, ok, you know what I don't get? The way guys can do so many mean things, and then not even care.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Multiple orgasms!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, all six are there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, Saturday night, the big night, date night, Saturday night, Sat-ur-day night!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No plans, huh?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Not a one.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Not even, say, breaking up with Janice?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, right, right, shut up.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Chandler, nobody likes breaking up with someone. You just gotta do it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, I know, but it's just so hard, you know? I mean, you're sitting there with her, she has no idea what's happening, and then you finally get up the courage to do it, and there's the horrible awkward moment when you've handed her the note.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Why do you have to break up with her? Be a man, just stop calling.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know, if you want, I'll do it with you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, thanks, but I think she'd feel like we're gangin' up on her.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I mean you break up with Janice and I'll break up with Tony.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Tony?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, you're breaking up with Tony?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know, he's sweet, but it's just not fun anymore, you know? I don't know if it's me, or his hunger strike, or, I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (waitressing) Does anybody want anything else?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, last week you had a wonderful, nutty, chocolatey kind of a cakey pie thing. (Rachel gives him a dirty look) Nothing, just, just, I'm fine.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) What's the matter? Why so scrunchy?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: It's my father. He wants to give me a Mercedes convertible.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That guy, he burns me up.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, it's a Mercedes if I move back home. Oh, it was horrible. He called me young lady .

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ooh, I hate when my father calls me that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did he give you that whole "You're-not-up-to-this" thing again?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, yeah. Actually, I got the extended disco version, with three choruses of "You'll never make it on your own".

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (rhythmically) Uh-huh, uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: Hi, Joey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: My god, Angela.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow, being dumped by you obviously agrees with her.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Are you gonna go over there?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, yeah, no, ok, but not yet. I don't wanna seem too eager. One Mississippi, two Mississippi, three Mississippi. That seems pretty cool. (he walks over to her) Hey, Angela.

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: (casually) Joey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You look good.

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: That's because I'm wearing a dress that accents my boobs.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You don't say.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, uh, Rachel, what are you, uh, what're you doing tonight?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, big glamour night. Me and Monica at Laundorama.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, you uh, you wanna hear a freaky coincidence? Guess who's doing laundry there too?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Who?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Me. Was that not clear? Hey, why don't, um, why don't I just join you both, here?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Don't you have a laundry room in your building?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, I do have a laundry room in my building, um, but there's a.... rat problem. Apparently they're attracted to the dryer sheets, and they're goin' in fine, but they're comin' out all.... fluffy. Anyway, say, sevenish?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: Forget it Joey. I'm with Bob now.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Bob? Who the hell's Bob?

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: Bob is great. He's smart, he's sophisticated, and he has a real job. You, you go on three auditions a month and you call yourself an actor, but Bob...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on, we were great together. And not just at the fun stuff, but like, talking too.

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, sorry, Joe. You said let's just be friends, so guess what?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: We're just friends.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Fine, fine, so, why don't the four of us go out and have dinner together tonight? You know, as friends?

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: What four of us?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You know, you and Bob, and me and my girlfriend, uh, uh, Monica.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment, Joey is there, trying to convince Monica to pose
as his girlfriend. His plan is to hook Monica up with Angela's boyfriend Bob and then take
Angela back for himself.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Monica, I'm tellin' you, this guy is perfect for you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Forget it. Not after your cousin who could belch the alphabet.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on. This guy's great. His name's Bob. He's Angela's... brother. He's smart, he's sophisticated, and he has a real job. Me, I go on three auditions a month and call myself an actor, but Bob is...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (looking out window) Oh, god help us.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ugly Naked Guy's laying kitchen tile. Eww!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Eww! Look, I'm asking a favor here. If I do this for her brother, maybe Angela will come back to me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What's going on here? You go out with tons of girls.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (proud) I know, but, I made a huge mistake. I never should have broken up with her. Will you help me? Please?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment, Joey is there, trying to convince Monica to pose
as his girlfriend. His plan is to hook Monica up with Angela's boyfriend Bob and then take
Angela back for himself.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on phone) Ok, bye. (hangs up) Well, Monica's not coming, it's just gonna be me and Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh. Well, hold on camper, are you sure you've thought this thing through?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's laundry. The thinking through is minimal.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It's just you and Rachel, just the two of you? This is a date. You're going on a date.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nuh-uh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yuh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So what're you saying here? I should shave again, pick up some wine, what?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, you may wanna rethink the dirty underwear. This is basically the first time she's gonna see your underwear—you want it to be dirty?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sheepish) No.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, and uh, the fabric softener?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, ok, now what is wrong with my Snuggles ? What, it says I'm a sensitive, warm kinda guy, you know, like a warm, fuzzy bear. Ok, I can pick something else up on the way.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: There you go.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: A fancy restaurant, Joey and Monica are there, meeting Angela and Bob, who
Monica thinks is Angela's brother.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thank you. So what does this Bob guy look like? Is he tall? Short?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yep.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Which?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Which what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You've never met Bob, have you?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, but he's...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my god, Joey, for all we know this guy could be horribly...

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: Hey, Joey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ...horribly attractive. I'll be shutting up now.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: A fancy restaurant, Joey and Monica are there, meeting Angela and Bob, who
Monica thinks is Angela's brother.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Phoebe are there, both ready to break up with their
significant others.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Where are they? Where are they?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: This is nice. We never do anything just the two of us.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It's great. Maybe tomorrow we can rent a car and run over some puppies.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Eww, I don't wanna do that.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Here we go.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, have a good break-up.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, Janice.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh, my god, I am so glad you called me. I had the most supremely awful day.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, that's not good. Can I get an espresso and a latte over here, please?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: We got the proofs back from that photo shoot, you know, the one with the little vegetables. Anyway, they pretty much sucked, so, I blew off the rest of the day, and I went shopping...(looks through her bags)... and I got you, I'm looking, I'm looking, I'm looking, I got you...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (covering) What... did you get me there?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: I got you...these. (pulls out a pair of socks)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Bullwinkle socks. That's so sweet.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Well, I knew you had the Rockys, and so I figured, you know, you can wear Bullwinkle and Bullwinkle, or you can wear Rocky and Rocky,or, you can mix and match, moose and squirrel. Whatever you want.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's great.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I'm gonna get another espresso. Can I get you another latte?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: (holding the full cup) No, no, I'm still working on mine.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was really hard.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, that hug looked pretty brutal.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, you weren't there.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Phoebe are there, both ready to break up with their
significant others.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Laundromat, Rachel is there, waiting for Ross. An old woman takes Rachel's
clothes off the machine and begins loading it with her things.]

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Comin' through. Move, move.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, 'scuse me. I was kinda using that machine.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, now you're kinda not.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: But I saved it. I put my basket on top.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sorry, is that your basket? It's really pretty. Unfortunately, I don't see suds.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: No suds, no save. Ok?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What's goin' on?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi, uh, nothing. That horrible woman just took my machine.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Was your basket on top?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, but, there were no suds.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, you know, no suds, no save.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No suds? Excuse me, hold on a second. (to woman) That's my friend's machine.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Hey, hey, hey, her stuff wasn't in it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, hey, hey, that's not the rule and you know it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to the crowd in the laundromat) All right, show's over. Nothing to see here. (to Rachel) Ok, let's do laundry.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That was amazing. I can't even send back soup.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, that's because you're such a sweet, gentle, uh...Do you, uh, do you...Oh, hey, uh you must need detergent.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What's that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uberveiss . It's new, it's German, it's extra-tough.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach, do you uh, are you gonna separate those?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh god. Oh, am I being like a total laundry spaz? I mean, am I supposed to use like one machine for shirts and another machine for pants?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach, have you never done this before?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, not myself, but I know other people that have. Ok, you caught me. I'm a laundry virgin.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, well, don't worry, I'll use the gentle cycle. Ok, um, basically you wanna use one machine for all your whites, a whole nother machine for colors, and a third for your uh, your uh, delicates, and that would be your bras and your under-panty things.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (holds a pair of panties in front of Ross) Ok, Well, what about these are white cotton panties. Would they go with whites or delicates?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (visibly nervous) Uh, that, that, that would be a judgment call.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Laundromat, Rachel is there, waiting for Ross. An old woman takes Rachel's
clothes off the machine and begins loading it with her things.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Fancy restaurant, Monica, Joey, Angela, and Bob are seated at the table.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Joey) He is so cute. (to Angela and Bob) So, where did you guys grow up?

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: Brooklyn Heights.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Cleveland.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How, how did that happen?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh my god.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I suddenly had the feeling that I was falling. But I'm not.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Fancy restaurant, Monica, Joey, Angela, and Bob are seated at the table.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Fancy restaurant, Joey and Bob are talking.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So, you and Angela, huh?

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Yep. Pretty much.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You're a lucky man. You know what I miss the most about her? That cute nibbly noise when she eats. Like a happy little squirrel, or a weasel.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Huh, I never really noticed.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, yeah, listen for it.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Monica, Monica is great.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, but it's not gonna last. She's too much for me in bed. Sexually.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Fancy restaurant, Joey and Bob are talking.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The ladies' bathroom at the restaurant, Monica and Angela are talking.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I've gotta tell you, Bob is terrific.

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: Yeah, isn't he?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It is so great to meet a guy who is smart and funny, and has an emotional age beyond, like eight.

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: You know what else? He's unbelievable in bed.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow. My brother never even told me when he lost his virginity.

dialogue.speaker: ANGELA
dialogue.text: Huh. That's nice.

scenes.location: The ladies' bathroom at the restaurant
scenes.event_description: [Scene: The ladies' bathroom at the restaurant, Monica and Angela are talking.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is coaching Chandler on how to break up with Janice.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, you can do this. It's just like pulling off a Band-aid. Just do it really fast, and then the wound is exposed.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Janice. Hi, Janice. Ok, here we go. I don't think we should go out anymore. Janice.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: All right. Well, there you go. (she gets extremely wound up, and begins to try and calm herself down) Stop it, stop it, stop it.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is coaching Chandler on how to break up with Janice.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, I know this is gonna sound really stupid, but I feel that if I can do this, you know, if I can actually do my own laundry, there isn't anything I can't do.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That does not sound stupid to me. You know, it's like the first time I had to make dinner for myself, after Carol left me? (the buzzer on the washer goes off) I'm sorry, that's all the time we have. Next on Ross...(opens up the washer) Uh-oh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What uh-oh?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (not wanting to tell her) Uh-oh, uh-oh, the laundry's done. It's, uh, it's a song. The laundry song that we sing. (singing) Uh-oh the laundry's done, uh-oh, uh-oh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, what's the matter?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nothing, nothing. Lee-lo, the laundry's done.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on, show me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right, all right, it's just that you left a red sock in with all your whites, and now, everything's kinda pink.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, everything's pink.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, uh, except for the red sock, which is still red. I'm sorry, please don't be upset, it could happen to anyone.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Except it didn't. It happened to me. Oh, god, I'm gonna look like a big marshmallow peep. What am I doing? What am I doing? My father's right. I can't live on my own! I can't even do laundry!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The fancy restaurant, Angela has her hand in Bob's shirt, and Monica is very
uncomfortable.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Something went wrong with Underdog, and they couldn't get his head to inflate. So anyway, um, his head is like flopping down Broadway, right, and I'm just thinking... how inappropriate this is. Um, I've got something in my eye, uh, Joey, could we check it in the light, please?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my god.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hello! Were we at the same table? It's like... cocktails in Appalachia.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on, they're close.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Close? She's got her tongue in his ear.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, like you've never gotten a little rambunctious with Ross.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, this is sick, it's disgusting, it's, it's—not really true, is it?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, who's to say what's true? I mean...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my god, what were you thinking?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, look, I'm not proud of this, ok? Well, maybe I am a little.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (hits him lightly) Oh!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ow!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (leaving) I'm outta here.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, wait. You want him, I want her. He likes you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. I'm thinking, if we put our heads together, between the two of us, we can break them up.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm so sorry, I can't believe I did this, but I couldn't stop laughing at your Norman Mailer story.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, waiter, one more plate of chicken wings over here.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The fancy restaurant, Angela has her hand in Bob's shirt, and Monica is very
uncomfortable.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is still trying to ease things over with Janice, and
there are about a dozen empty Espresso cups in front of him. He is extremely wired.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Here's the thing, Janice. You know, I mean, it's like we're different. I'm like the bing, bing, bing. You're like the boom, boom, (Chandler flails his hand out and hits Janice in the eye)... boom.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Ow!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, my god, I'm so sorry. Are you ok?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Ow. Um, it's just my lens. It's just my lens. I'll be right back.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) I hit her in the eye! I hit her in the eye! This is the worst break-up in the history of the world.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my god. (Chandler downs another espresso.) How many of those have you had?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I don't know, a million?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Chandler, easy, easy. Go to your happy place. La la la la la la la.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm fine.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm not fine. Here she comes.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait here. Breathe.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: How do you do that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It's like a gift.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We should always always break up together.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I'd like that.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is still trying to ease things over with Janice, and
there are about a dozen empty Espresso cups in front of him. He is extremely wired.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Laundromat. Rachel is sorting her now-pink clothes.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You got the clothes clean. Now that's the important part.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I guess. Except everything looks like jammies now.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Whoa, I'm sorry. Excuse me. We had this cart.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, I had a 24-inch waist. You lose things. Now come on, get outta my way.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, you know, maybe I wasn't being clear. Uh, this is our cart.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Hey, hey, hey there aren't any clothes in it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, hey, hey, hey, quit making up rules!

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Let go!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, listen, missy. If you want this cart, you're gonna have to take me with it!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Yes! Did you see that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You were incredible! Brand new woman, ladies and gentlemen.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I could not have done this without you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, um, uh, more clothes in the dryer? (Ross turns and bangs his head on an open dryer door.) I'm fine, I'm fine.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Are you sure?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No.

scenes.location: The Laundromat. Rachel is sorting her now-pink clothes.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Laundromat. Rachel is sorting her now-pink clothes.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there. Ross has an icepack to his
head.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, are you sure you're ok?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Does it still hurt?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (seeing Rachel's clothes) What a neat idea. All your clothes match. I'm gonna do this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, how'd it go?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Excellent.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We ripped that couple apart, and kept the pieces for ourselves.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What a beautiful story. Hey, I'm fine by the way.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (notices his head) Oh, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Where's Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, he needed some time to grieve.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm free! I'm free!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That oughta do it.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there. Ross has an icepack to his
head.]
